channel.title: [PI] a problem with ::yell type command [PI]

item.title: [PI] a problem with ::yell type command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @gigabyt3r gigabyt3r
item.description:
@gigabyt3r wrote:

Change the substring,

if (playerCommand.startsWith("cbspeak") && c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Peeko")) { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; c2.sendMessage("[@blu@CB-Mod@bla@] " + c.playerName + ": @bla@" + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(8))); } } }

item.title: [PI] a problem with ::yell type command [PI]
item.dc:creator: @sagi_x-evolution sagi x-evolution
item.description:
@sagi_x-evolution wrote:

ok guys so heres the code

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“cbspeak”) && c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“Peeko”)) {
for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) {
if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j];
c2.sendMessage("[@blu@CB-Mod@bla@] " + c.playerName + “: @bla@” + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)));
}
}
}

so the problem im having is, if peeko says ::cbspeak hi then the message appears as [CB-Mod] Peeko: Ak hi
im not sure whats wrong but i dont want this “ak” there… no matter what message he types, ak is always there i cant figure out why this is happening and how to remove…

Read full topic
